article.paragraph: Use mdy datesJune 2012BLP sourcesMarch 2010Charles Baxter(born May 13, 1947) is an American novelist, essayist, and poet.
article.heading: Biography
article.paragraph: Baxter was born inMinneapolis, Minnesota, to John and Mary Barber (Eaton) Baxter. He graduated fromMacalester CollegeinSaint Paul, MinnesotaSaint Paul. In 1974 he received his PhD in English from theUniversity at Buffalo, The State University of New YorkUniversity at Buffalowith a thesis onDjuna Barnes,Malcolm Lowry, andNathanael West.
article.heading: Career
Teaching
article.paragraph: Baxter taught high school inPinconning, Michiganfor a year before beginning his university teaching career atWayne State UniversityinDetroit, Michigan. He then moved to theUniversity of Michigan, where for many years he directed the Creative Writing MFA program. He currently teaches at theUniversity of Minnesotaand in theWarren Wilson College MFA Program for Writers.
